content: your needles note position your needles so that the first 6 6 8 8 10 10 stitches are on one needle and the last 6 6 8 8 10 10 are on the other hold the needles so that your working yarn is on the right side attached to the furthest right stitch on the back needle cut your yarn leaving a 30 cm / 12 tail graft the heel using kitchener stitch 9 @thestitchling finishing to finish your turner socks weave in all ends and wet block when soaking the socks you may need to take precautions to avoid colour bleeding when drying make sure you either use a sock blocker or pin the socks to shape this will help to even out any waviness around your colourwork pattern support email queries to thestitchlingdesigns@gmail com i will attempt to respond in a timely manner sharing please share your projects with the hashtags #turnersocks and #thestitchling and tag @thestitchling disclaimer please respect the time that i have invested in producing this pattern and the fact that this design is my intellectual property you may not reproduce any part of this pattern or commercially manufacture garments from it if you wish to handknit my pattern as a personal commission please only do so on a small scale never producing in excess of five garments 10
